availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Allen McQuithy (Bath County, Kentucky, student and private (U.S.A.))

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, student and solider. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel McQuithy and Maria Anderson McQuithy. Resident of Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Student in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as private from November 26, 1862 to September 16, 1863. Captured at Mt. Sterling, Kentucky, on March 22, 1863. Prisoner of war in Richmond, Virginia, from March 22, 1863, to May 11, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 2, p. 17B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 3.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 12071.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0131.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 379.
